project.teaser: SKILLBILL’s overall objective is to develop a large and strong foundation for the growth and acceleration of renewable energy’s deployment, thanks to engaging with stakeholders of the whole chain, diffusing scientific culture and skilling multi-level workers.The basic idea...
project.objective:
SKILLBILL’s overall objective is to develop a large and strong foundation for the growth and acceleration of renewable energy’s deployment, thanks to engaging with stakeholders of the whole chain, diffusing scientific culture and skilling multi-level workers. The basic idea underling the project is that the knowledge should be diffused at several different levels and qualitatively appropriate both to train the adequate number of workers and to increase RES awareness and to reach a more social and inclusive Europe
The project aims at creating several pathways to induce target groups to get interested or involved in RES besides their initial level of education and their working position: the technological RES potential can be reached by increasing hard and soft skills of potential users and stakeholders, developing interest in the topic and having clear and appropriate approaches, such as tools and learning modules using suitable language. It’s important, beside the creation of instruments for the upskilling and reskilling of workers, technician and designers, to have awareness modules for unspecific public in order to fight against ignorance, fake news, gender gap and the phenomenon of functional illiteracy: it is widely documented that lifelong suitable learning process is the fundamental driver to support the development, maintenance and update of skills.
SKILLBILL proposes concrete actions to accelerate the deployment of renewable energy at different levels: 1. Stakeholder community engagement 2. Knowledge sharing and peer learning 3. Skilling, upskilling, reskilling
SKILLBILL will i) analyse and involve all the interested parts in open discussion using adequate language; ii) create several different pathways to increase skills after having mapped knowledge gap and without gender prejudice; iii) develop and implement innovative learning method; vi) evaluate the work performed.

project.keywords: Skill, European Master, Vocational Educational Training, Stakeholder engagement

result.title: Report on training needs analysis
result.description: The report will describe the analysis performed to assess user segments to be addressed by the training courses, including current and expected skills, benchmark, training needs, quality of the courses and of the materials produced.

result.title: Stakeholder map and good practices
result.description: The report the results of the stakeholder mapping to facilitate the development of our programmes for higher education WP4 and vocation education and training WP5 an targeted desk research to map the stakeholder community to identify key groups of players across the quadruple helix then the description of the 30 semistructured interviews

result.title: Co-design of joint stakeholder initiative
result.description: the report to describe the activities performed on the task:- the initial design for the initiative including the number of working groups to be established and the thematic focus of each one, while also developing a baseline operational model along with key performance indicators and selection criteria for their members- the organization of the Digital Co-Creation Workshop- the results of the workshop

result.title: Quality label definition
result.description: Report on the quality label specifications and its use the label will give information on different evaluation categories eg quality level elementary advanced etc the type of users reliability communication etc through a radar chart the information to be evaluated and how to evaluate them

result.title: Dissemination and Communication Plan
result.description: The Dissemination and Communication plan, follow a step-wise methodology to elaborate on what to disseminate, to whom, who and how, including:•development of the project identity (graphic elements and logo)•basic promotional package •structure of the web portal and social media; •communication and dissemination material (online and offline); •promotional video;the initial version will be updated at the end of the project

result.title: PMP and DMP
result.description: Document of Project Management Plan PMP and Data Management Plan DMPThe initial set up of simple rules for internal communication document filled and stored properly where how who title version revisions use and storage etc will evolve in order to present the status of the projects reflections on data management A final version of updated document will be produced and at least 1 revision will be done in the course of the project one just before the end of the first reporting periodthe PMP will include Internal communications Template for monthly electronic update to be regularly filled by WPL Schedule management GANTT Work Breakdown Structure WBS Projects commitments an Excel file evidencing all projects milestone outputs deliverables and results timelines and funds in order to monitor the effective project progress a schedule per task responsible partner related subtasks related deliverables and dependencies on other tasksFinancial and Resource management Projects cash flows Excel file for monitoring budget structure and timeframe cash flow and forecast expenditure updated every 6 months by each partner the DMP will describe what kind and how data will be collected processed maintained and shared during and after the end of the project it provides toolsannexes that will be updated during project life not generating a new version of PMPA specific chapter will be dedicated to open access to research dataA specific chapter will be dedicated to Social Ethical Legal Privacy issues identification and monitoring

result.title: Training programmes, storyboards and materials (initial and final ver.)
result.description: The report will describe training programmes, storyboards and material; the chapter describing the VR training material will be produced by METThe initial version will be updated at the end of the project

result.title: Exploitation, IPR Management and Sustainability Plan
result.description: Exploitation IPR Management and Sustainability PlanA separated chapter of the in the Exploitation Plan final version will include the business plan elaborated for future expansion regarding VR platform Master and VET development maintenance The initial report will be updated at the end of the project

result.title: QA&RMP
result.description: the document Quality Assurance and Risk Management Plan QARMP will cover all aspects related to technical quality of data produced and risk management of the project Risk assessment and monitoring Coordination of contingencies following CAPA technique Corrective Action and Preventive Action

result.title: Master syllabus
result.description: the document will describe the approved student learning content, assessment standards, teachers rules, responsibilities and expectations associated with the Master.

result.title: Social impact monitoring methodology and assessment
result.description: Report on social impact (positive or negative) of project’s interventions: higher education in WP4 and vocational training programmes in WP5, green portal in WP3, stakeholder joint initiative in WP2. The report will include the indicators for monitoring and assessing such impacts (e.g. benefits in skilling, reskilling and upskilling efforts, changes in awareness, interest, knowledge, attitudes, etc.)The initial report will be updated at the end of the project

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
